TopicTitle: How to put a Satellite for Starters.:

Articles.Content: Okay, so clicking on this means your a starter wanting to put a satellite into orbit. Okay so first get a design in your head. You might want to use a probe body with a xeon container thing with a ion rocket ( Those little ion things ) as the actual body of the satellite. You then to, of course, put some solar panels, any choice you but the gigantic ones. Add some Z-100 rechargeable batteries about for four solar panels, and a communitron 88-88 for that like one of those dish thing on top of a house. Then you need a booster stage. Basically anything that can get you into orbit. Make Sure you get a decoupler too! If you don't you'll have a big stage on the bottom of the satellite. Thats basically it. If you're ready to do better, build a Mk3 space plane with cargo bay doors then build a satellite attached to that, decouple that from the plane when in orbit and land back. Feel free to add more tips for any starters.
Illustrating your suggestions would help make your points. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
